author: lennext
title: Beyond Create Teaming Agreements
description: It is hard & can be costly for funded Catalyst proposals to select a jurisdiction and type of juristic entity. But success demands they do.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge brief by creating a legal framework for new teams of developers to join Cardano and have at their disposal standard documentation that gets them started, specifically: 1) how do ensure that all team members are legally bound to the deliverable what the proposer calls KYC; 2) how do they structure the public company, or DAO to cater to their project; 3) how do they ensure that the funds distributed from Catalyst go to all team members by implementing a multisig. Coming from a place where I had to set-up a company myself, having this would have been extremely beneficial, therefore I strongly agree that this is a needed deliverable for the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project promises to deliver: 1.1) document templates for teams members KYC to avoid team conflicts and know who each of the members and; 1.2) a multisig solution for distributing funds to team members once the funding from catalyst is received; 2) continues research and curating relevant legal information on incorporating DAOs into a bespoke website.

The document templates for agreements between team members (1.1.) is definitely deliverable by the proposers given their strong background in legal as presented on their website. Delivering (1.2) will be a little more challenging given the core competencies of the are in legal rather than tech and this would be a tech solution, for which they will need to recruit; 2) creating a website and curating with recent news and updates to regulatory guidance certainly deliverable given experience of the lawyers (https://lexfuturus.io/our-team/ for full team).

However I do feel that given the team's experience there could more delivered, particularly in section 2, where what the community needs is a turn key templates and set of specific steps on how to incorporate in different regions. The team includes a lwayer in Russia, a lawyer in Nigeria, a lawyer in Malaysia, a lawyer in UK and a lawyer in the US. So it would be good to see templates on how to incorporate in those regions and/or specific guidance on regulation with a formed legal opinion. For this reason I give a 4 rather than a 5
f6_assessments.q2: The phases provided for the audit are clear and verifiable; 1) phase 1 to onboard a researches is a yes or no check; 2) phase 2 to create a website produce the information is also verifiable event in addition to the monthly control reports. The success will be decided by how much use it gets from the community which is fairly objective. I found a refreshingly positive surprise that the proposer discloses all the other projects in Catalyst that they had in the past and the ongoing ones - this is rare to see in proposals and a good upfront disclosure that shows how this continues from the previous proposals and if lets the voter decide to what extent the proposer and team might be overextending themselves if there are too many proposals in the current fund.

f6_assessments.q0: Regulatory compliance is very important for crypto projects. But unfortunately, most proposers have no idea about the law compliance in their own country, not speaking about the worldwide picture. The source with the correct information you can trust and people you can get legal advice from is a must for many projects that get funding on Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: Having business owners and a business attorney as part of the team makes this project highly likely to be implemented and provide valid, useful information.
f6_assessments.q2: Estimated time is provided along with two phases with the description. The team also shows how to measure the success of the project. The information is sufficient for the start.

f6_assessments.q0: I would have like if the team had provided some clearer indication of how the community can audit their project or if the auditing will be done exclusively through catalyst updates. The team have presented deliverables from a previous proposal and the internal auditing mechanisms are structured in a very detailed manner. There are multiple measures of success given. This proposal presents sufficient proof of auditability however the community auditing aspect is not clear.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is large, diverse and distributed among multiple jurisdictions. The team have also established themselves as a dependable proposer by delivering on a previous fund proposal with proof of deliverables that are available to the community. The team presents more than enough competence to be able to complete project such as is proposed, I therefore feel there is a high probability of success in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I would have like if the team had provided some clearer indication of how the community can audit their project or if the auditing will be done exclusively through catalyst updates. The team have presented deliverables from a previous proposal and the internal auditing mechanisms are structured in a very detailed manner. There are multiple measures of success given. This proposal presents sufficient proof of auditability however the community auditing aspect is not clear.

f6_assessments.q0: Many projects on the Cardano ecosystem lack understanding of jurisdiction and the laws about cryptocurrency. The proposal tries to help teams by giving a teaming agreement template and updating news and status of regulatory and fiscal issues that can impact project teams. The proposal articulate clearly how and what will they do the current challenge. The team also provides several potential risks from many factors, from technology to teaming issues, and gives each a reasonable way to overcome them.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a detailed plan and roadmap of what will they do in what time frame by giving into two main phases. The team provides budget information but not enough breakdown of how they will use the proposed budget. For example, from 8K$/month on phase 2, how is the distribution between researcher, resident attorney, curator, and project manager? and how many are gonna be used for technical costs? for server, hosting, or domain name, for an instance. The proposal gives very detailed information regarding the background, skills, and experience of each team member, they also attach a LinkedIn profile for each member of the team.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics for success are clearly defined by dividing into tho phases, each with a specific timeframe. The team also gives specific goals for indicators of success. However, its gonna be better if they provide a specific number for each social media as an outcome KPI. Such as 50 site views each day, 1000 subscribers, or more 10 questions from the community can be answered daily.

f6_assessments.q0: Your proposal explains the problem thoroughly and offers a reasonable solution. Fund 7 results have also been mentioned here. According to what you said, Fund 8 will continue the work of Fund 7. I can see information about the jobs you have provided. How it addresses the challenge is also explained. It's great because it brings many benefits to Cardano. At the end of this section, I can see a few risks mentioned and it's great that you have a solution to minimize each risk.
f6_assessments.q1: In the proposal, 3 phases of the project were mentioned. In each stage, you've outlined the tasks that need to be done. I consider this a good roadmap. Furthermore, you have also provided a detailed budget breakdown. About your team, their ability and experience is unquestionable. I believe with this team, your project will soon achieve success.
f6_assessments.q2: In this section, you've made sure to report your project's progress on a monthly basis and the challenge team's reviews on the site. I also understand the success you have drawn for the project. However, to make the project more specific, convincing and feasible, I think you should add specific indicators. This will facilitate the project monitoring process. In the success description, you can further emphasize the value it brings to the ecosystem and the community.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a platform for Law-as-Code is a fantastic way to establish economic identity in Cardano and any DApp. Different laws from around the world will be integrated into Cardano DApps, making it a valuable resource and convenient for users. The proposer also provides an example and explains why this is significant. By providing an example and an analysis of how this project benefits DApp, the proposer is able to explain why this proposer aligns with the challenge setting. Furthermore, the team includes lawyers to reduce the danger of misinterpretation; they have complete legal backing to ensure the law as code is secure. The risks are present in paragraph and are given appropriate solution and cited from trusted source. Finally, the proposer includes some good metrics for this project that they plan to give in bullet points. These metrics are related with challenge KPIs.
f6_assessments.q1: This is an enormous project, but the proposer did an excellent job of planning an instructive roadmap and budget breakdown. However, when I look at the roadmap, I get the impression that something is missing. A perfect plan not only displayed the accomplishments but also demonstrated how the accomplishments were accomplished. Despite the fact that the proposer has provided a significant deal of detail on the project, they should specify the works that are required for those accomplishments. The budget breakdown is fairly detailed, indicating that the proposer or team has already decided who they will require. In addition, the proposer provides information on team members, such as work experience, skills, and links to demonstrate and connect to. With a team full of experts from the government, Catalyst communities, open-source companies, and other organizations, I am confident that the project will be a success.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a very good explanation of the measurements; it was designed for 10 points, and each point has extensive numbers/rates. The fact that the measures are so explicit ensures the auditability of the progress and the success of the project. Based on these metrics, the community can assess and compare whether the proposal is on track. The success of this initiative will benefit the Cardano community. Furthermore, the proposer intends to solicit user feedback to ensure that the project is on track and to help improve the Cardano community's capability. I believe this information is critical, and the team will do great things as a result.

f6_assessments.q0: As a developer and a business developer I strongly agree that the proposal effectively addresses the challenge by helping to solve one important problem which is the formalization of associative terms and tools and is clearly stated in the proposal. If the goal is achieved it will definitely help to further incentivize developers by facilitating them to produce proper agreements and project/operation conditions easier and with less hassle. As a way to improve, on new proposals and also if funded, during the building of the website, I think the language and angle used to describe the solution can be more simple and direct, as it took me at least three readings to really understood what was the purpose and committed in the proposal, but the basis are there.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team brings great experience, suited for the task to be done. Len is also a well known and active member of the community, with great contributions and a critical thinking, also the provided materials out of the first part of this project (Funded in F7), even being drafts are well thought and have great value.
The budget requested is aimed to cover costs for two main tasks:
On one side to pay for 4 roles at an average of $2.000 each per month for 6 months, which it is ok with market and catalyst usual rates (even less than average I will say, which shows commitment from the founders to serve the community). That adds up to $48.000 total, even though no detailed breakdown of costs were provided, I think the intention for the funds is clear here.
On the other side, to build a website and hire a researcher, with $16.000 being requested, stating that $10.000 will be spent on the website building, with a timeframe of 6 weeks. As no detail is being provided on what type of site is going to be built or the team involved in the building, is hard to properly assess if the funds requested are adequate, there's no mentioning of what is going to be paid with the remaining $6.000. So feasibility is at risk here, even though there's a note, that the founding team will cover any extra expenses if the funds are exhausted, as the site required for this type of project/service is not a complex one, it is more likely that there could be an over-budget here. The plan also is very broad and lack of details. The allocated time for building the site might not be enough. I do trust that with the founders experience, if the project is funded they will provide the missing details and explanations to show the scope and specific deliverables that will be achieved more clearly. Risks where properly identified and mitigation plans are inline with them (Besides the one stated here).
f6_assessments.q2:
The plan and milestones provided is broad and general, so in order for the project to be ready to get audited, a higher level of details shall be provided, and I am confident that the proposers will provide that details, if the proposal is voted.
As the timeframe covers 6 months of work, any delays/deviation with the website building can be catch up during that timeframe (even though it is unlikely, because it is a simple site), reports can be delivered to updating the community, and as the proposers stated, they will assume any extra costs, so the proposal can be successful.
The outcome KPIs (ROI) provided makes totally sense and are inline with the challenge objectives, measuring adoption and usage from the community, which indirectly is measuring community building, good communication channels and engagement from the people accessing this services/materials. Also surveys will be offered to gather and understand structured feedback. With that and the detailed plan (that should be provided) the community will be able to successfully audit the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This extends upon previous proposals to provide crucial agreements to developers working in a virtual world. It is of direct relevance to the developer ecosystem of not only Cardano but any development project that employs individuals across a disparate geography.
f6_assessments.q1: They have committed to providing past outcomes from past successfully funded projects to the community within 2 weeks. On the strength of this commitment and the fact that this proposal is a continuation of a successful Fund 7 proposal, the answer is an unequivocal yes.
f6_assessments.q2: The outcomes will be binary - they exist or they will not. Furthermore their past project proposals will be demonstrated to yield results further supporting the ultimate evidence of auditability - project results.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is about further improvement and/or additional features to an already funded project" Create Teaming Agreement", and most importantly to address project and mangement issues/features/risks regarding  the success of the growing number of projects in the ecosystem. The proposal's problem statement is certainly in alignment with the challenge settings in creating an enabling environment for developers and its community to thrive and in ensuring regulatory compliance and good business practice.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has provided a detailed information on the team's competence and in addition, it is  needless to say that having successfully presented a proposal in Fund 7 cycle which is almost at the deliverable  stage, it is a testament that the team is capable . There is a detailed plan of implementation and milestones which are quite reaosnable. Also, it was obvious that the team had taken into consideration, all possible risk factors and how to tackle them. from the information provided, it is clear that the project will be successfully and effectively implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has expressed the basis and reliable measures to monitor the progress and development of the project, In addition, the detailed milestones can be used to assess the performance of the project. However, there is no statement of quantifiable success metrics in the proposal which the community can evidently monitored to prove the success of the project if funded.

solution: Continue the work begun in 'Create Teaming Agreement-Fund 7" to help funded proposers understand regulatory compliance and good practice.
experience: Two experienced business owners and investors each with MSc Blockchain and Digital Currency degrees working in Catalyst since Fund 2 and founding partner Lex Futurus Decentralized Legal Advisory Group - blockchain specialist members in Nigeria, UK, Malaysia, USA, Russia.
